alert.note: Alert for Tooele (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 4:17PM MDT until September 21 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Jacob City burn scar in... Eastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Jacob City Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in flash flooding and debris flows which will cross the county road in Soldier Canyon then move into and downstream Soldier Creek. Flows are then expected to move downstream in Soldier Creek to SR 36 near mm 47 and the adjacent UPR rail line. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Soldier Canyon and Stockton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
